info.title: Equipment
info.description:
The Equipment API provides endpoints for equipment and asset management, including:
* Creating & managing site equipment nodes
* Defining equipment hierarchy & node relationships
* Attaching & managing equipment telemetry

### Understanding Equipment Nodes 
 An **Equipment Node** is a platform representation of a piece of physical equipment on-site, such as an air handler, chiller, or pump.

Equipment node definition and taxonomy in Counterbalance is defined by the guidelines in [Project Haystack](https://project-haystack.org/).

 The top-level Haystack equipment tags currently supported are: `ahu`, `chilledWaterPlant`, `chiller`, `coolingTower`, `boiler`, `fan`, `heatExchanger`, `heatPump`, `hotWaterPlant`, `pump`, `vav`

#### Equipment & Marker Tags
Equipment nodes are defined using a top-level equipment tag and a variety of marker tags.  

#### Parent/Child Relationships
Equipment nodes can be defined to create a parent/child relationship that follows-that of the actual equipment onsite. Examples include an air handler that serves multiple VAV boxes or chilled water plant and its associated chillers, pumps, cooling towers, etc.

The permitted parent/child taxonomy is shown in the following table.

| Parent Equipment Tag | Permitted Children Equipment Tags |
|---|---|
| `ahu` | `fan`, `vav`, `zone` |
| `chilledWaterPlant` | `chiller`, `heatExchanger`, `pump`, `coolingTower` |
| `hotWaterPlant` | `boiler`, `heatExchanger`, `pump` |

#### Dependent Relationships
Equipment nodes can also define dependent relationships between nodes. A dependent node is attached via a Haystack system reference (such as `chilledWaterPlantRef`, `hotWaterPlantRef`, etc). The available references for a particular equipment node are dictated by the Haystack tags assigned to the node.

For example, let's say you define an AHU with a `chilledWaterCool` marker tag. When this tag is assigned, the `chilledWaterPlantRef` reference also becomes available. If this references is attached to a chilled water plant node, this AHU will become dependent on the chilled water plant.

> **Remember** Parent/child and dependent relationships are critical for accurate fault detectionand building intelligence routines. We highly recommend being as thorough and complete with these relationship definitions as possible.

get.description:
Retreieve a list of equipment nodes

**Required Permissions:** `*`,`equipment:*`,`equipment:node:*`,`equipment:node:list`

post.description:
Create a new equipment node

**Required Permissions:** `*`,`equipment:*`,`equipment:node:*`,`equipment:node:read`

> **Heads Up** This endpoint is subject to `equipment` quota availabilty

name.description: A name for the new node

description.description: A brief description of the equipment

markers.description: A space-seperated list of marker tags

@parent.description: The parent equipment node of this node

metadata.description: User-defined JSON data for this node

tag.description: The Haystack equipment tag that defines the node

description.description: The Haystack description of the node

parent_ref.description: Indicates that children nodes can be attached via the Haystack equipment reference provided

permitted_children_equipment.description: The permitted children node types that can be attached to this node. *Only present if `parent_ref` is not null.*

@ref.name: @ref
@ref.description: Filter results by their parent or dependent node UUID

@siteId.name: @site
@siteId.description: Filter results by their associated site UUID

tag.name: tag
tag.description: Filter results by their Haystack equipment tag

error.console: Please check the node ID and try your request again

count.description: The number of equipment nodes returned

index.description: An array of node IDs in the order returned

equipment.name: Air Handler
equipment.description: An enclosure with a fan that delivers air to a space via ductwork and performs one or more of the functions of cleaning, heating, cooling, humidifying, dehumidifying, ventilating or circulating the air

tag_definitions.name: Hot Water Heat
tag_definitions.description: The AHU utilizes a hot water heating coil

tag_definitions.name: Chilled Water Cooling
tag_definitions.description: The AHU utilizes a chilled water coil

tag_definitions.name: Variable Volume
tag_definitions.description: The AHU supplies a variable volume of air

tag_definitions.name: VAV Zone
tag_definitions.description: The AHU supplies air to VAV terminal units

tag_definitions.name: Dual Duct
tag_definitions.description: The AHU uses two ducts which is some combination of hotDeck, coldDeck, or neutralDeck

equipment.name: Air Handler
equipment.description: An enclosure with a fan that delivers air to a space via ductwork and performs one or more of the functions of cleaning, heating, cooling, humidifying, dehumidifying, ventilating or circulating the air

tag_definitions.name: Direct Expansion (DX) Cooling
tag_definitions.description: The AHU utilizes a direct expansion (DX) cooling coil

tag_definitions.name: Variable Volume
tag_definitions.description: The AHU supplies a variable volume of air

tag_definitions.name: VAV Zone
tag_definitions.description: The AHU supplies air to VAV terminal units

tag_definitions.name: Multi Zone
tag_definitions.description: The AHU supplies air to multiple zones

tag_definitions.name: Single Duct
tag_definitions.description: The AHU uses a single supply duct

equipment.name: Chiller
equipment.description: Equipment to remove heat from a liquid. Chillers typically use a vapor compression or an absorption refrigeration cycle

tag_definitions.name: Water Cooled
tag_definitions.description: The chiller is cooled by a condenser water system

equipment.name: Variable Air Volume Terminal Unit
equipment.description: VAV systems use a constant air temperature with a variable air flow rate

tag_definitions.name: Cooling Only
tag_definitions.description: The VAV does not have a fan

tag_definitions.name: Single Duct
tag_definitions.description: The VAV has a single supply duct
